setting.name: Clean Shutdown
setting.description:
Safely shut down the cellular component before removing power.
Performing a shutdown allows the module to unregister from the cellular network and safely store operating parameters. Failure to shut down properly has the potential to result in delays resuming network operation and in some rare instances may result in an unrecoverable module failure.

setting.name: Phone Number
setting.description: Read the SIM card phone number.

setting.name: ICCID
setting.description: Read the ICCID (Integrated Circuit Card Identifier) of the inserted SIM.

setting.name: IMEI
setting.description: Read the module IMEI (International Mobile Equipment Identity).

setting.name: IMSI
setting.description: Read the IMSI (International Mobile Subscriber Identity) of the inserted SIM.

setting.name: Operator
setting.description: Read the network operator on which the module is registered.

setting.name: Modem Firmware Version
setting.description: Read the firmware version string of the cellular modem.

setting.name: Modem Firmware Revision Number
setting.description: Read the firmware revision number of the cellular modem.

setting.name: Cellular Signal Strength
setting.description: Read the absolute value of the current signal strength to the nearest cell tower in dB

setting.name: Cellular Network Time
setting.description: Read the current network-provided local time of the XBee, in seconds since 2000-01-01 00:00:00 UTC. The value is empty if the time is not known. The value is synchronized with the network approximately once per hour.

setting.name: Access Point Name (APN)
setting.description: Specifies the packet data network that the modem will use for Internet connectivity. This information is provided by your cellular network operator. Hyphen (-) means no APN specified. Asterisk (*) is the wildcard APN. See documentation for more information.

setting.name: Username
setting.description: Specifies the username used when authenticating to the cellular network. This setting is write only. A value of a single space character (ASCII 0x20) acts as an empty value.

setting.name: Password
setting.description: Specifies the password used when authenticating to the cellular network. This setting is write only. A value of a single space character (ASCII 0x20) acts as an empty value.

setting.name: SIM PIN
setting.description: Specifies the PIN for using a SIM. This setting is write only. A value of a single space character (ASCII 0x20) acts as an empty value.

setting.name: SIM PUK
setting.description: Specifies the PUK for unlocking a SIM. This setting is write only. A value of a single space character (ASCII 0x20) acts as an empty value.

setting.name: Operating APN
setting.description: Read the APN value currently configured in the cellular component.

setting.name: Airplane Mode
setting.description: When set, the cellular component of the XBee is fully turned off and no access to the cellular network is performed or possible

setting.name: Antenna Diversity
setting.description: Assign the function of the secondary external antenna. It can be disconnected and unused, it can be used for cellular diversity for better reception, or it can be used to connect an external Bluetooth antenna as well.

setting.name: IP Protocol
setting.description: The protocol used for the listening port (ATC0) while the module is in Transparent mode (ATAP = 0). 0 - UDP Communication, 1 - TCP Communication, 2 - SMS Communication, 3 - Reserved, 4 - SSL over TCP Communication

setting.name: SSL/TLS Protocol Version
setting.description: The SSL/TLS Protocol Version used for the SSL socket. 0 - SSLv3, 1 - TLSv1.0, 2 - TLSv1.1, 3 - TLSv1.2

setting.name: SSL/TLS Profile 0
setting.description: Specifies the SSL/TLS certificate(s) to use in transparent mode (when IP=4) or API mode (frame type 0x20, or frame type 0x23 with profile set to 0). Format: server_cert;client_cert;client_key

setting.name: SSL/TLS Profile 1
setting.description: Specifies the SSL/TLS certificate(s) to use for API frame type 0x23 transmissions with profile set to 1. Format: server_cert;client_cert;client_key

setting.name: SSL/TLS Profile 2
setting.description: Specifies the SSL/TLS certificate(s) to use for API frame type 0x23 transmissions with profile set to 2. Format: server_cert;client_cert;client_key

setting.name: IP Client Connection Timeout
setting.description: The IP client connection timeout. If no activity for this timeout then the connection is closed. When set to 0 the connection is closed immediately after data is sent.

setting.name: TCP Server Connection Timeout
setting.description: The TCP server connection timeout. If no activity for this timeout then the connection is closed. When set to 0 the connection is closed immediately after data is sent.

setting.name: Device Options
setting.description: Device Options Bit field. Bit 0 - Enable Remote Manager. Other bits are reserved and must be 0.

setting.name: Remote Manager FQDN
setting.description: Fully Qualified Domain name of Remote Manager Server.

setting.name: Server Send Keepalive Interval
setting.description: The Remote Manager Server Send Keepalive Interval value. The XBee will consider the Remote Manager connection to have failed after 3 missed keepalives.

setting.name: Device Send Keepalive Interval
setting.description: The Remote Manager Device Send Keepalive Interval value. Remote Manager will consider the connection to have failed after 3 missed keepalives.

setting.name: Remote Manager Status Check Interval
setting.description: How often the XBee performs a status check to Remote Manager.

setting.name: Remote Manager Options
setting.description: Device Options Bit field. Bit 0 - Always remain connected through TCP Bit 1 - Secure TCP connection using TLS Bit 2 - Reserved (Set to 1) Other bits are reserved and must be 0.

setting.name: SSL/TLS Certificate File
setting.description: Specifies the SSL/TLS Remote Manager certificate.

setting.name: Remote Manager Phone Number
setting.description: Phone numbers must be numeric and optionally prefixed with '+' for international dialing, 5 to 20 characters

setting.name: Remote Manager Service ID
setting.description: A code used to disambiguate Remote Manager when using SMS shared short codes. Use a space character to disable service ID matching.

setting.name: Remote Manager Description
setting.description: Description of the XBee that is displayed in Remote Manager.

setting.name: Remote Manager Contact
setting.description: Contact information for the XBee that is displayed in Remote Manager.

setting.name: Remote Manager Location
setting.description: Location of the XBee that is displayed in Remote Manager.

setting.name: Health Metric Selection
setting.description: Metrics to report to DRM Bit 0 - Cellular Signal Strength Other bits are reserved and must be 0.

setting.name: Health Metric Reporting Interval
setting.description: How often the XBee reports metrics to Remote Manager.

setting.name: Serial Number High
setting.description: The upper digits of the unique IMEI assigned to this module.

setting.name: Serial Number Low
setting.description: The lower digits of the unique IMEI assigned to this module.

setting.name: Module IP Address
setting.description: The IP address of the module. This command is Read Only and is assigned by the mobile network.

setting.name: Destination Phone Number
setting.description: The destination phone number (used for SMS when ATIP = 2). Phone numbers must be numeric and optionally prefixed with '+' for international dialing, 5 to 20 characters)

setting.name: Primary DNS Address
setting.description: IPv4 address of the primary domain name server.

setting.name: Secondary DNS Address
setting.description: IPv4 address of the secondary domain name server.

setting.name: Destination Address
setting.description: The destination IPv4 address (e.g. XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX) or fully qualified domain name (e.g. example.com)

setting.name: Operating Destination Address
setting.description: The destination IPv4 address currently in use by transparent mode.

setting.name: Destination Port
setting.description: The destination IP port number.

setting.name: Listening Source Port
setting.description: The listening IP port number for UDP and TCP operations

setting.name: Baud Rate
setting.description: The serial interface baud rate for communication between the serial port of the module and the host. Request non-standard baud rates with values above 0x80 using a terminal window and then read the BD parameter to find actual baud rate achieved.

setting.name: Parity
setting.description: The parity for the UART.

setting.name: Stop Bits
setting.description: The number of stop bits for the UART.

setting.name: Packetization Timeout
setting.description: The number of character times of inter-character delay required before transmission begins. Set to zero to transmit characters as they arrive instead of buffering them into one RF packet.

setting.name: Text Delimiter
setting.description: The text delimiter to be used for transparent mode. Set to zero to disable text delimiter checking

setting.name: Flow Control Threshold
setting.description: The flow control threshold. De-assert CTS when FT bytes are in the UART receive buffer.

setting.name: API Enable
setting.description: The API mode setting. RF Packets received can be formatted into API frames to be sent out the UART. When API is enabled the UART data must be formatted as API frames as transparent mode is disabled.

setting.name: DIO0/AD0
setting.description: The DIO0/AD0 pin configuration. Options include: Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO1/AD1/SPI_ATTN
setting.description: The DIO1/AD1/SPI_ATTN pin configuration. Options include: SPI_ATTN, Analog to Digital converter, I2C SCL and Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO2/AD2/SPI_SCLK
setting.description: The DIO2/AD2/SPI_SCLK pin configuration. Options include: SPI_SCLK, Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO3/AD3/SPI_SSEL
setting.description: The DIO3/AD3/SPI_SSEL pin configuration. Options include: SPI Slave Select, Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO4/SPI_MOSI
setting.description: The DIO4/SPI_MOSI pin configuration. Options include: SPI Slave MOSI, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO5/ASSOCIATED_INDICATOR
setting.description: The DIO5/ASSOCIATED_INDICATOR pin configuration. Options include: Associated LED indicator (blinks when associated), Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO6/RTS
setting.description: The DIO6/RTS pin configuration. Options include: RTS flow control input, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO7/CTS
setting.description: The DIO7/CTS pin configuration. Options include: CTS flow control output, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO8/SLEEP_REQUEST
setting.description: The DIO8/SLEEP_REQUEST pin configuration. Options include: Sleep Request input, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO9/ON_SLEEP
setting.description: The DIO9/ON_SLEEP pin configuration. Options include: ON/SLEEP Output, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO10
setting.description: The DIO10/PWM0 pin configuration. Options include: RSSI PWM Output, PWM0 Output, Digital Input, and Output.

setting.name: DIO11
setting.description: The DIO11 pin configuration. Options include: - Fan Enable - I2C SDA - Digital Input - Digital Output - PWM

setting.name: DIO12/SPI_MISO
setting.description: The DIO12/SPI_MISO pin configuration. Options include: SPI Slave MISO, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO13/DOUT
setting.description: The DIO13/DOUT pin configuration. Options include: Disabled, UART DOUT enabled.

setting.name: DIO14/DIN
setting.description: The DIO14/DIN pin configuration. Options include: Disabled, UART DIN enabled.

setting.name: Pull Direction
setting.description: The resistor pull direction (1=pullup, 0=pull-down) for corresponding I/O lines that are set in PR command.

setting.name: Pull-up/down Resistor Enable
setting.description: The bit field used to configure internal pull-up/down resistors status for I/O lines. 1=internal pull-up/down enabled, 0=no internal pull-up/down. Bit field map: (14)-DIO13/DOUT, (13)-DIO7/CTS, (12)-DIO11, (11)-DIO10, (10)-DIO12, (9)-DIO9/On/nSleep, (8)-DIO5/Assoc., (7)-DIO14/DIN, (6)-DIO8/Sleep_Request, (5)-DIO6/RTS, (4)-DIO0/AD0, (3)-DIO1/AD1, (2)-DIO2/AD2, (1)-DIO3/AD3, (0)-DIO4

setting.name: PWM0 Duty Cycle
setting.description: The duty cycle of PWM0.

setting.name: PWM1 Duty Cycle
setting.description: The duty cycle of PWM1.

category.name: I/O Sampling
category.description: Configure I/O Sampling Parameters. Click on + to expand the list of parameters.

setting.name: Temperature
setting.description: The current module temperature in degrees Celsius in 8-bit two's-complement format. For example 0x1A = 26C, and 0xF6 = -10C

setting.name: Bluetooth Enable
setting.description: Configure the module to enable Bluetooth.

setting.name: Bluetooth MAC Address
setting.description: Read the module's EUI-48 Bluetooth MAC address

setting.name: Bluetooth Identifier
setting.description:
The name to include in BLE advertisements.
When set to the default value (ASCII space character, 0x20), the name will be the XBee 3 product name.

setting.name: Bluetooth Authentication
setting.description: Configure Bluetooth authentication with a password or an SRP salt/verifier.

category.name: Authentication
category.description: Parameters for authenticating Bluetooth API access

setting.name: SRP Salt
setting.description: 32-bit random value to make attempts to brute force passwords more difficult.

setting.name: SRP Verifier (part 1)
setting.description: Most significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

setting.name: SRP Verifier (part 2)
setting.description: Second most significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

setting.name: SRP Verifier (part 3)
setting.description: Third most significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

setting.name: SRP Verifier (part 4)
setting.description: Least significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

setting.name: Sleep Mode
setting.description: In Normal mode the module is always awake. In Pin sleep the module sleeps when the SLEEP_RQ pin is asserted. Cyclic mode sleeps for SP time and wakes for ST time. Cyclic sleep pin wake is the same as cyclic sleep but SleepRq must be active to allow sleep, otherwise the module will stay awake.

setting.name: Sleep Time
setting.description: The sleep time of the module. In cyclic sleep mode, node will sleep with CTS disabled for the sleep time interval, then wake for the wake time interval.

setting.name: Wake Time
setting.description: The wake time for cyclic sleep modes.

setting.name: Command Sequence Character
setting.description: The character value used to enter command mode. The default value (0x2B) is the ASCII code for the plus ('+') character. It must be entered three times within the guard time to enter command mode.

setting.name: Command Mode Timeout
setting.description: The command mode timeout parameter. If no valid commands have been received within this time period, module returns to Idle Mode from AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Guard Times
setting.description: The required period of silence before, after, and between the Command Mode Characters of the Command Mode Sequence (GT + CC + GT). The period of silence is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Python Auto Start
setting.description: Configure the module to automatically run compiled MicroPython bytecode stored in flash.

setting.name: Diagnostics Configuration
setting.description: For Digi Technical Support use only.

setting.name: Firmware Version
setting.description: Read the module firmware version number.

setting.name: Verbose Firmware Version
setting.description: Read the verbose firmware version number.

setting.name: Hardware Version
setting.description: Read the module hardware version number.

setting.name: Association Indication
setting.description: Read the Association status code to monitor association progress.

setting.name: Remote Manager Indicator
setting.description: Monitor Remote Manager connectivity. 0=Connected with no TLS or authentication, 1=Before connection to the Internet, 2=Remote Manager connection in progress, 3=Disconnecting from Remote Manager, 4=Not configured for Remote Manager, 5=Connected over TLS, 6=Connected over TLS with authentication

setting.name: Over the Air update indicator
setting.description:
Monitor the status of remote cellular component update activity.
0x0=Last update succeeded 0x1=Update file transfer failed 0x2=Update image rejected by cellular component 0x10=There was a problem processing the update request 0x11=Update was blocked by XBee sleep 0xfe=An update is currently in progress, 0xff=No update status to report.

setting.name: Protocol/Connection Indication
setting.description: Read the Protocol/Connection status code to monitor IP connection (when ATIP = 0 or 1) or SMS send status (when ATIP = 2).

setting.name: Hardware Series
setting.description: Read the module hardware series number.

setting.name: Configuration CRC
setting.description: The CRC of the current settings. The purpose of this command is to allow the detection of an unexpected configuration change on a device. After a firmware update this command may return a different value.
